intro: Planchonella sandwicensis var. molokaiense, commonly known as Molokai hibiscus, is a rare endemic plant native to the Hawaiian island of Molokai. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its shrub-like growth habit with leathery, elliptical leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are followed by orange-colored, fleshy fruits containing numerous seeds. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, typically found in coastal or lowland forests. Due to habitat loss and limited distribution, it is considered a critically endangered species.
